availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: Edgar Baird (Bath County, Kentucky, farmer and soldier.)

body.p: Kentucky native. Son of Harding Baird and Louise J. Baird. Farmer in Bath County, Kentucky, in 1861. Served in the 24th Kentucky Infantry Regiment (U.S.A.) as private from December 31,1861. Reported as deserted from Louisville, Kentucky, on May 1, 1862. Served in the 10th Kentucky Cavalry Regiment (U.S.A.) as corporal from September 9, 1862, to September 17, 1863.

ab.bibl:
Ninth Manuscript Census of the United States (1870), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Bath County, Wyoming, p. 123B.
Report of the Adjutant General of the State of Kentucky, vol. 1, 1861-1866 (Frankfort: Kentucky Yeoman Office, 1866), 245.
Compiled Service Records of Volunteer Union Soldiers who Served in Organizations From State of Kentucky, NARA RG 94, Microfilm Series M397, Roll 0365.
